sentences.sentence: This is Euronews Now, I'm Helena Humphrey and here are your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The UN calls for a security zone to be set up around the Zaporizhia nuclear power plant in Ukraine to prevent a disaster. It's been the site of constant shelling with both sides blaming each other. Russian President Vladimir Putin lashes out at economic sanctions imposed on his country by the West, saying they're wrecking the quality of life for Europeans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And Britain's new Prime Minister, Liz Truss, has formed the most diverse cabinet in UK history without a single white man, holding the country's four most important ministerial positions.

sentences.sentence: Although the agency was careful not to blame either side, it said there was an urgent need for interim measures to prevent a nuclear accident caused by military action. And all relevant parties need to agree on a protection zone to avoid further damage.

I mean the sanctions fever of the West and its aggressive attempts to force modes of behavior onto other nations, to strip them of sovereignty and to subdue to its own will.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Many Western-based multinationals and retailers have pulled out of Russia in line with the sanctions, reversing a trend of decades of investment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The full impact of these measures has yet to become clear.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A recent decision by G7 Western powers to cap oil prices has provoked an angry response from Moscow, which depends heavily on oil revenues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Moscow's decision to shut down the Nord Stream 1 pipeline that provides Europe with much of its gas supplies is seen in the West as a direct reprisal, the latest salvo in an evolving economic conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday attended sweeping war games with China in his country's Far East in a show of military muscle amid the tensions with the West over Moscow's action in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: According to the Kremlin, over 50,000 soldiers will be involved in the drills, using 140 aircrafts and 60 ships.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Participating countries also include several of Russia's neighbours, including Syria and India.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The week-long exercises are largely intended to display growing defense ties between Russia and China.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Putin's presence at the war game signifies the importance the Kremlin is placing on this relationship building with participating nations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: For China's part, Beijing has refused to criticize the Kremlin's actions in Ukraine and has accused the West of provoking Moscow. India has also refrained from imposing sanctions.

sentences.sentence: The measures equate to around 2% of Lithuania's economy and will cap electricity and gas prices while providing support to businesses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The plan also includes a variety of energy saving measures such as setting heating limits for public buildings at 19 degrees and air conditioning to 27 degrees, as well as mandating remote work on Fridays and Mondays.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Investment into green energy will be encouraged.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, in France, some sports facilities such as swimming pools and ice rinks are already being closed. One country-wide pool operator saw their energy costs hit 100 million euros, up from just 15 million.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Transport could be hit too.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Fewer trains are reportedly being considered this winter as a way to save energy, meaning those that do run will be very busy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And local mayors are researching whether they can turn off streetlights after midnight without compromising safety.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Portugal is the latest EU member state to announce measures to support families

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: as inflation hits a 30-year. And Prime Minister Antonio Costa did not hesitate to reveal how much this will cost the state coffers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Thanks to responsible budget management, we can safely adopt this new set of measures that this year alone will have an additional cost of 2.4 billion euros exclusively dedicated to families.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: For Costa, helping struggling families is important, but he insists it must be done responsibly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: What is essential is that we manage to combine measures that in the short term help families to maintain their purchasing power but do not feed the spiral of inflation which we increase prices today and then they increase tomorrow and we lose tomorrow what we increased today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The measures include 125 euros to each citizen with an income under 2,700 euros per month, plus 50 euros for each child in the family, while pensioners will receive an extra 50% top-up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In 2022, the national minimum wage remains fixed at 822 euros per month, or just under 10,000 per year, one of the lowest in the bloc.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09

To help her, she needs her own top team, so Liz Truss spent her first few hours in number 10 sacking some of the old cabinet and creating her own. The appointments came fast and furious but with an emerging theme. A predominance of those who backed her for the premiership but it was also noticeably diverse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Heading the list a new Chancellor or Finance Minister Kwasi Kwarteng.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Anne Therese Coffey gets the health portfolio and becomes Deputy Prime Minister, making the Truss and Coffey top duo the first all-female one in history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: James Cleverley becomes Foreign Secretary, replacing Truss herself. While Ben Wallace broke the pattern and remains as Defence Secretary, a position he's held since 2019. Creating cabinets and appointing their support staff can take days, but Truss has to hit the ground running. She has her fans, but also her critics.
